00025 int determinedaycode(int year)
00026 {
00027         int daycode;
00028         int d1, d2, d3;
00029 
00030         d1 = (year - 1.)/ 4.0;
00031         d2 = (year - 1.)/ 100.;
00032         d3 = (year - 1.)/ 400.;
00033         daycode = (year + d1 - d2 + d3) %7;
00034         return daycode;
00035 }
00036 
00037 int determineleapyear(int year)
00038 {
00039         if(year% 4 == FALSE && year%100 != FALSE || year%400 == FALSE)
00040         {
00041                 days_in_month[2] = 29;
00042                 return TRUE;
00043         }
00044         else
00045         {
00046                 days_in_month[2] = 28;
00047                 return FALSE;
00048         }
00049 }
00050 
00051 void calendar(int year, int daycode)
00052 {
00053         int month, day;
00054         for ( month = 1; month <= 12; month++ )
00055         {
00056                 printf("%s", months[month]);
00057                 printf("\n\nSun  Mon  Tue  Wed  Thu  Fri  Sat\n" );
00058 
00059                 // Correct the position for the first date
00060                 for ( day = 1; day <= 1 + daycode * 5; day++ )
00061                 {
00062                         printf(" ");
00063                 }
00064 
00065                 // Print all the dates for one month
00066                 for ( day = 1; day <= days_in_month[month]; day++ )
00067                 {
00068                         printf("%2d", day );
00069 
00070                         // Is day before Sat? Else start next line Sun.
00071                         if ( ( day + daycode ) % 7 > 0 )
00072                                 printf("   " );
00073                         else
00074                                 printf("\n " );
00075                 }
00076                         // Set position for next month
00077                         daycode = ( daycode + days_in_month[month] ) % 7;
00078         }
00079 }

00081 int main(int argc, char* argv)
00082 {
00083         int year, daycode, leapyear;
00084         
00085         //read your from command line
00086         year = argv[1];
00087         //determine day code
00088         daycode = determinedaycode(year);
00089         //determine leap year   
00090         determineleapyear(year);
00091         //print the calendar
00092         calendar(year, daycode);
00093         printf("\n");
00094 }
